title: 2-Lane Breakdown Sequence
description: MOST DANGEROUS PHASE - Maximum vigilance required. CRITICAL: Signs WITH traffic (same as setup), Cones AGAINST traffic (OPPOSITE of setup), Vehicle in reverse during cone removal.

items.label: SIGNS: Remove WITH traffic (same direction as installation)
CONES: Remove AGAINST traffic (OPPOSITE of installation)
VEHICLE: Operates in REVERSE during cone removal
FLAGGING: Continues until ALL cones removed
MOST DANGEROUS PHASE: Last cones provide least protection
ALL work activities ceased - no ongoing work
ALL workers out of roadway - in safe location
ALL tools removed from work area
Work vehicles moved outside closure to protected area
Qualified observer assigned - dedicated role
Radios checked - functional comms
Storm whistles accessible - ready for emergency
Escape routes confirmed - still clear
Traffic volumes assessed - not too heavy
NOTE: DO NOT begin until work area completely clear

sections.title: Phase 1: End Work Activities and Clear Zone

items.label: Complete current task - safe stopping point
Put tools in vehicle - all equipment secured
Move equipment to shoulder - safe area
Remove personnel from lanes - ALL out
Work vehicle exits - parks outside termination taper
Maintain amber lights - vehicle still visible
Flagger 1 continues at Approach A taper start - maintains control
Flagger 2 continues at Approach B termination - coordinates
Maintain radio contact - both flaggers and crew
Flagger 2 prepares to transition - becomes removal worker
NOTE: Flagging CRITICAL - continues until ALL cones removed
Flagger 1 holds traffic - Approach A with STOP paddle
Flagger 2 stops traffic - Approach B
Flagger 2 radios: 'Approach B stopped, removing termination taper'
Walk AGAINST traffic - toward work area, facing traffic
Pickup termination cones - typically 6 cones
Maximum 3 cones at a time - manageable weight
Carry to shoulder or load in truck
Face traffic while removing - continuous vigilance

sections.title: Phase 4: Remove Work Area and Buffer Cones (AGAINST TRAFFIC)

items.label: Position shadow vehicle 50-100ft upstream of worker
Shadow driver acts as observer - amber lights active
Removal worker walks AGAINST traffic - faces oncoming
Pickup cones working downstream
Maximum 3 cones at a time
Shadow vehicle follows at worker pace - maintains 50-100ft distance
Qualified observer continuous watch - ready to signal danger
NOTE: MAXIMUM DANGER - last cones provide least protection

sections.title: Phase 5: Remove Transition Taper Cones (MOST DANGEROUS)

items.label: Coordinate with Flagger 1 - radio: 'removing taper cones now'
Flagger holds or controls traffic as needed
Remove taper AGAINST traffic - start upstream end
Work downstream toward work area
Shadow vehicle very close - 25-50ft protection
Escape route continuously available - always ready
Storm whistle ready - immediate danger use
WARNING: MOST DANGEROUS PHASE - least protection remaining
Remove signs Approach A - furthest upstream to downstream
Qualified observer required throughout
Passenger observes, driver retrieves
Remove signs Approach B - same sequence
Verify all equipment retrieved - nothing left behind
Drive through former work area - final sweep
Verify no equipment on roadway - complete clear
Verify no debris remaining - clean site
Radio: 'breakdown complete, zone clear' - final confirmation
NOTE: Signs removed WITH traffic (same direction as installation)
